items.name: Get Compliance
items.description: Tool to retrieve compliance data for sites, categories, or questions. use when you need odata-based compliance data for analytics or reporting.

$count.description: Whether to include a total count of matching records.
$count.title: $Count

$expand.description: Comma-separated list of related entities to expand.
$expand.title: $Expand

$filter.description: OData filter expression to narrow results (e.g., 'Rank gt 5').
$filter.title: $Filter

$orderby.description: OData orderby clause to sort results (e.g., 'Rank desc').
$orderby.title: $Orderby

$select.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include in the response (e.g., 'Name,Rank').
$select.title: $Select

$skip.description: Number of records to skip for paging (minimum 0).
$skip.title: $Skip

$skiptoken.description: Server-driven pagination token from previous response.
$skiptoken.title: $Skiptoken

$top.description: Maximum number of records to return (minimum 1).
$top.title: $Top

_maxPageSizeInMb.description: Max size in MB for each request, between 1 and 450 (default is 50).

successful.title: Successful

items.name: Get Channel Details
items.description: This tool retrieves metadata and details for a specific channel in ably. it returns a channeldetails object containing information about the channel's status, occupancy, and other metadata. the endpoint provides visibility into channel activity, including metrics such as connections, presence, publishers, and subscribers, and requires appropriate permissions.

input_parameters.description: Request model for getting channel details

channel_id.description: The ID of the channel to retrieve details for
channel_id.title: Channel Id

input_parameters.title: GetChannelDetailsRequest

isActive.description: Whether the channel is currently active
isActive.title: Is Active

metrics.description: Metrics about channel occupancy including connections, presence, publishers, and subscribers

connections.description: Total number of realtime connections attached to the channel
connections.title: Connections

objectPublishers.description: Number of connections publishing object updates
objectPublishers.title: Object Publishers

objectSubscribers.description: Number of connections subscribed to object updates
objectSubscribers.title: Object Subscribers

presenceConnections.description: Number of connections permitted to enter presence on the channel
presenceConnections.title: Presence Connections

presenceMembers.description: Number of members in the presence set of the channel
presenceMembers.title: Presence Members

presenceSubscribers.description: Number of connections receiving presence messages on the channel
presenceSubscribers.title: Presence Subscribers

publishers.description: Number of connections permitted to publish messages to the channel
publishers.title: Publishers

subscribers.description: Number of connections receiving messages from the channel
subscribers.title: Subscribers

metrics.title: Metrics

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: Get Channel History
items.description: This tool retrieves the message history for a specified ably channel. it uses the get /channels/{channelid}/messages endpoint to return a paginated list of messages in chronological order, subject to parameters such as 'channelid', 'limit', 'direction', 'start', and 'end'. the tool is useful for auditing, recovering missed messages, analyzing channel activity, and debugging message flows. authentication is required via basic or token authentication.

input_parameters.description: Request model for getting channel history

channel_id.description: The ID of the channel to retrieve history for
channel_id.title: Channel Id

direction.description: The direction of this query. The direction determines the order of the returned result array
direction.title: Direction

end.description: The end of the query interval as a time in milliseconds since the epoch
end.title: End

limit.description: The maximum number of records to return. A limit greater than 1,000 is invalid
limit.title: Limit

start.description: The start of the query interval as a time in milliseconds since the epoch
start.title: Start

input_parameters.title: GetChannelHistoryRequest

messages.description: Array of messages matching the query criteria

items.description: Model for a single message in the channel history

timestamp.description: Message timestamp in ms since epoch
timestamp.title: Timestamp

items.title: Message

messages.title: Messages

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful
